thread.title: Man lands nearly 6 years in prison for pot robbery that turned deadly
thread.title_full: Man lands nearly 6 years in prison for pot robbery that turned deadly | OregonLive.com

author: Emily E. Smith | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Man lands nearly 6 years in prison for pot robbery that turned deadly
text:
Two men pulled a robbery last year hoping to score a bucket of marijuana, Beaverton police said. One was killed during the hold-up , while the other was sentenced to prison this month for second-degree robbery.
Police say Amjad Ahmed Alkofi and Victor Gutierrez-Prieto had planned to rob Dallas Urig, then 25, and Kyle Hansen, then 29, on Sept. 10, 2014.
Gutierrez-Prieto lured the victims to the Birch Pointe Apartments in Beaverton, police said.
As they walked through the complex, Alkofi ran up behind Urig and Hansen, who was carrying a 5-gallon bucket filled with weed, pointing a gun at them, police said. Hansen started to run away, and Alkofi fired at him.
Urig then pulled out a handgun and shot at 24-year-old Alkofi, killing him. Urig and Hansen, who was not wounded, then drove home to Bend.
Court records say Urig and Hansen planned to turn themselves in after talking to an attorney, but police caught up with them first.
The Washington County District Attorney's Office determined that Urig acted in self-defense when he shot Alkofi and declined to prosecute him.
Victor Gutierrez-Prieto Courtesy of Beaverton Police Department Gutierrez-Prieto, 29, was charged with first- and second-degree robbery and unlawful use of a weapon. He pleaded guilty Sept. 11 to second-degree robbery and received a sentence of five years and 10 months in prison, court records show.
Rebecca Woolington of The Oregonian staff contributed to this report.
-- Emily E. Smith
